data.title: Cool place with good food
data.text: I took my children here to eat.  We all loved the atmosphere and the food.  We totally recommend you visit.

data.title: Good tasting burgers, a little expensive
data.text: Our family enjoys Teddy's because they have an interesting selection of burgers and they are always cooked to order.  It is a little expensive, particularly because it has a diner vibe and counter service, but we think it is worthwhile.  Not so outstanding that I recommend it to visitors from out of town, but a solid establishment that we frequent once every couple months.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: What a fun west coast chain to have here in Iowa City. The big burger was the perfect size and the fries with cheese sauce were stellar. I'd come back just for the fries!

data.title: Old fashioned malt and burgers
data.text: Teddy's is a great burger place.  It takes me back to the malt and burger places we frequented in the 60's.  The same hamburger and burnt buns aroma.  Get a malt and fries to go with your burger.

data.title: A bit of Hawaii in Iowa
data.text: Nice hamburger place in Iowa.  Started in Hawaii and has come to Iowa City.  Very nice and friendly staff.  Loved my Hawaiian burger.  The burgers taste like they are home made.  Would go again if in town.

data.title: An unknown burgers and shakes venue
data.text: I enjoy the food, especially, the milk shakes.  I had a burger this time---it was very good.  The restaurant was very clean; staff were efficient and polite.

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: Found Teddy's one day when walking around in downtown I.C. and loved it.  It is a Hawaiian (yeah!) chain that had made strides into the mainland.  They come in three sizes, 5, 7, and 9 oz. patties, or double each size if you are really, really, REALLY hungry.  They can be topped with your choice of toppings, or you can order one of their specialty burgers with appropriate toppings.  All are very good, but expensive.  There are also chicken options that are excellent, as well as salads for the lighter eaters.  But really, when you go there, you aren't going there to eat light!  the sides are pretty much fast food sides, fries, tater tota, onion rings, etc.  We really enjoy the tots, they are fried crispy, and are seasoned just right, and the rings are good.  Overall, good place to get a burger, but don't go if you are watching the calories.  All you will do here is watch them pile up, but you will enjoy doing it!

data.title: Parched
data.text: We were pretty disappointed in the burgers.  They were pretty dry and didn't have much flavor.  The fries were OK.  The staff were all really kind and helpful though.

data.title: Excellent burgers
data.text: I stopped in for a quick lunch. Sign on the door cautions that they are not a fast food establishment but everything is cooked to order and may take longer. I thought I was served in a very reasonable time.  The "small " burger is a 5 oz patty. Also available  9 and 13 oz patties.  Lots of toppings and condiments available. I had a small combo with a burger with cheese and jalapeños added, excellent fries and a drink for about ten bucks. I left full and satisfied. Will go back.

data.title: Good burger!
data.text: This was delicious...then I made the mistake of looking at the nutrition facts so I can't bring myself to go back! Darn it!

data.title: DREADFUL!
data.text: I have only eaten at Teddy's one time and I will not be returning.  I ordered a hamburger and it was very spicy or peppery or something bad.  I ate about half of the hamburger to attempt to give it a chance and had to stop.  I do not like any type of spicy foods and I can't stand pepper, so maybe it would have been great for some people.  The service was very good, though and the staff was very nice.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: If you're looking for a twist on a good burger and fries, try this place. They have a unique way of ordering, which the helpful staff explains. The food is delicious. Definitely a must try on your "cheat" meal.

data.title: Best Burger in Iowa City
data.text:
Great selection of burger options (Hawaiian, Bleu Wave, Slaw Daddy) as well as fries (garlic, cajun, cheese), and they also serve two vegetarian burgers (Veggie or Turkey) that are just as good.

I have been here several times as well as other places in Iowa City that serve burgers and Teddy's has the best in town.

Try anything on the menu

data.title: GREAT Customer Service
data.text: I visited Teddy's with a friend a couple nights ago. The woman who took our order had a big smile, was quite friendly, and took time to explain the menu. We ordered a couple basic burgers, fries and a drink. Prices are not bad, considering that the food tastes better than your average fast food. Special sauce on burger was drippy. Fries were excellent--hot and crispy. Their pickle slices seem hand cut. Each order is made fresh, so some wait time. We didn't mind this. Three sizes of burgers from which to choose, and multiple cheese options. I didn't enjoy the smoky taste of the burger, because I don't enjoy that flavor. Restaurant seemed clean, and atmosphere was free of fluorescent lighting found in most fast food places.

data.title: Best Burger around
data.text: Not only are the burgers great, the onion rings and fries are pretty tasty.  The person who took our order was beyond helpful and friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.  Great customer service.

data.title: Great burgers,  cool theme
data.text:
Stopped in for lunch before a business meeting.   The staff was very friendly and helpful;  asking if we'd been there before and then explaining the menu.

The food was great, restaurant was clean and I liked the Hawaiian theme.

data.title: Exceeded Expectations
data.text: I expected a burger. I got more! Thank you Teddy's for a burger so good I needed triple the napkins. I ordered the single with pastrami and extra swiss at about $8. Very juicy with the sauce, and the bun was Hawaiian. So good and I have been recommending it to everyone. Order took about 10 minutes and was worth the wait. Call and pick it up to avoid the lines. Fries were a little weak... but the buttered parm ones looked good. Love the food in downtown IC and this one exceeded expectations!

data.title: Average
data.text: Average food but not necessarily complaining, well kinda. The burger was juicy which is all you can ask for I guess.

data.title: Yummy taste of Hawaii in IC!
data.text: The family and I have been to Teddy's twice now and both times were great. The burgers are juicy, the milkshakes are fabulous and the staff is so friendly! I love the hawaiian style burger, add jalapeños with a pineapple milkshake, heaven!! The only drawback is that it is a bit pricey but the quality of food is worth it.

data.title: No! Two bites, and I threw it away!
data.text: I really regret forgetting my lunch at home today. This had to be one of the worst burgers I have ever eaten. I've had school lunch burgers that were better! I love burgers, and when I saw the sign I was drawn to the cheesy juicy looking burger. But when I took the first bite I was grossly underwhelmed by the flavors, and by the second bite I was done - something was "off" and I threw it away because it was gross. This was a charbroiled messy disaster! Not to mention I ordered garlic fries and it was okay - but the grease from the fries soaked into the bottom of the burger bun creating a nasty mess. I ended up wasting money on that and had to buy something else. And for the other reviewer who said this was like 5 Guys : This is nothing like 5 Guys - 5 Guys is amazing!!!
